definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
to be in debt/to be saddled with debts

sentences.english: Took back-to-back to more distant light years.
sentences.chinese: 毅然背對揹走向更遠的光年。

sentences.english: This is a bad design practice that runs counter to our internal design guidelines.
sentences.chinese: 這是違揹我們內部設計指導方針的不好的設計實踐。

sentences.english: One day, I spend 4 hours to carry the fountain from the Yang Tai Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 一天，我花了4個小時從陽臺山揹回了山泉水。

sentences.english: Without my blessing, not a leaf will fall.
sentences.chinese: 沒有葉子會違揹我的旨意飄落。

sentences.english: No. 8 T-bag: You think you are the only one who feels betrayed?
sentences.chinese: 你以爲只有你認爲被人揹離了嗎？

sentences.english: Lovesickness is a condition brought upon us, against our will, by a force somehow external to us.
sentences.chinese: 相思病是被外力違揹我們的意志強加於身上的。

sentences.english: It never violates the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: 它從不違揹物理學定律。

sentences.english: No. 8 ☆T-bag: You think you are the only one who feels betrayed?
sentences.chinese: 你以爲只有你覺得被人揹叛了嗎？

sentences.english: To tell even a little fib gose against my grain.
sentences.chinese: 即使撒點小謊，也違揹我的個性。

sentences.english: Try not to walk with such a stoop.
This scorpion wanted to cross a river, so he asked the frog to carry him.
sentences.chinese: 有隻蠍子想過河，於是請青蛙揹他。

sentences.english: This action goes against my conscience.
sentences.chinese: 這一行動違揹我的良心。

sentences.english: Chen Decai was back to the station, Lin Jason let people don't wake him.
sentences.chinese: 陳德財被揹回駐地，林傑森讓人不要叫醒他。

sentences.english: The cousin fears when canaliculus too, call my back her, I disrelish a trouble, did not manage her.
sentences.chinese: 堂妹過小溝時害怕，就叫我揹她，我嫌麻煩，沒理她。

sentences.english: Qin days back home Qiang shen, just be red fruits and ling jie encounter.
sentences.chinese: 秦天把沈薔揹回家，正好被紅果和凌桀碰到。

sentences.english: Filled with admiration for Yugong, the Emperor of Heavens ordered two mighty gods to carry the mountains away.
sentences.chinese: 天帝佩服愚公的精神，就命兩位大力神揹走二山。

definition: to carry on the back or shoulders (Cantonese)
load carried by a pack animal
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
plant mentioned in Book of Songs, uncertainly identified as carambola or star fruit (Averrhoa carambola)
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
knag/a kind of sled used to cross a muddy area (old)
